content.description: This the warm up for the area.  Easy climbing down low to several fun face moves at the top.
content.location: Start a few feet left of Pass the Jar.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Squeal Like a Pig
climbs.fa: Noah Monagle, Karl Kiser & Steve Hattenbach, winter 2014

content.description: The climbing is easy for two bolts and the action starts at the third bolt (look for the hidden left pocket for an easy third clip).  The next moves are relatively insecure.
content.location: The route is the last route on the right and left of the green graffito.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Pass the Jar
climbs.fa: Karl Kiser, Noah Monagle & Bryan Pletta, Fall 2013

content.description: The climbing is relatively straight forward with the crux following the fourth bolt.
content.location: The route is left of the large roof, left of the cave opening.  Rap the route.

content.description: The crux is moving above the second bolt.  It is a harder read.
content.protection: Bolts to anchors and chain at the top.
content.location: The route is just left of the cave opening.  Rap the route.

content.description: The roof start is the crux.  You get another star if you do a sit down start.
content.protection: Bolts to anchor and chains at the top.
content.location: The route is right of Death by Tractor on the right side of a small rock depression.  Rap the route.

content.description: The crux is above the fourth bolt getting to the anchor.
content.location: Th climb is about 10 yards right of Pass the Jar where the ledge narrows.  It is better to stick clip the first bolt because of chewy rock at the start.  Rap the route.

content.description: The crux is at the top from the last bolt to the anchor.  The start is also a bit bouldery so milk the rest in the middle prior to climbing the crux.
content.protection: Bolts to anchor and chains at the top.
content.location: The route is about ten feet right of Kissing Kousins near a dead tree at the top.  Rap the route.

content.description: This climbing area is the extreme left side of the Terrace.  It faces a bit northwest and is the same limestone band.
